member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient
member.summary:
A class that represents a single gRPC connection which can be used to handle gNMI communication. This requires the CommunicationGateway DxM to be available.
'Channel' refers to a virtual connection to a conceptual endpoint in the DxM. 'Connection' refers to an active gRPC (HTTP2) connection with an endpoint. 'DataSource' refers to a conceptual endpoint and its identifying parameters. 'Node' refers to a location in the OpenConfig schema, represented by a path. A node can be a leaf, a container, a list, ...

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._responseHandlers
member.summary: Mapping from the command type to the function handling said command.
member.remarks: Any new request type for this handler should be added in PrepareRequestHandlers().

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._natsDxmTimeoutTimer
member.summary: A watchdog timer to check if the DxM on NATS is still sending messages (responses, events, or heartbeats). Will disconnect when breached.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._natsHeartbeatRequiredTimer
member.summary: A watchdog timer to check if we have been silent for too long and need to send a heartbeat message to the DxM. When the DxM does not receive any message from us, it will forcibly close the connection.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._emptyRequestBytes
member.summary: We often need an empty request (e.g. for heartbeats), so avoid the memory trouble and just create it once. We cannot make it a value in the class definition since it is generated from a proto file.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._dataMapper
member.summary: An optional object that can be set on a client which will take care of processing and executing an action on the notification.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._isDxmConnected
member.summary: We cannot make a property volatile, so we use a private member to hold the connected state as volatile.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._isFullyDisconnected
member.summary: Boolean to know if a full disconnect was requested.
member.remarks: This avoids the race condition where the timeout timer and heartbeat would try to reconnect when the disconnect was requested at the same time.

member.name: T:Gnmi.Encoding
member.summary: Encoding defines the value encoding formats that are supported by the gNMI protocol. These encodings are used by both the client (when sending Set messages to modify the state of the target) and the target when serializing data to be returned to the client (in both Subscribe and Get RPCs). Reference: gNMI Specification Section 2.3

member.summary: ASCII text of an out-of-band agreed format.

member.name: F:Gnmi.Encoding.JsonIetf
member.summary: JSON encoded text as per RFC7951.

member.name: T:Gnmi.Notification
member.summary: Notification is a re-usable message that is used to encode data from the target to the client. A Notification carries two types of changes to the data tree: - Deleted values (delete) - a set of paths that have been removed from the data tree. - Updated values (update) - a set of path-value pairs indicating the path whose value has changed in the data tree. Reference: gNMI Specification Section 2.1

member.name: T:Gnmi.SubscribeRequest
member.summary: SubscribeRequest is the message sent by the client to the target when initiating a subscription to a set of paths within the data tree. The request field must be populated and the initial message must specify a SubscriptionList to initiate a subscription. The message is subsequently used to define aliases or trigger polled data to be sent by the target. Reference: gNMI Specification Section 3.5.1.1

member.summary: An optional field to specify that only updates to current state should be sent to a client. member.name: T:Gnmi.SetRequest
member.summary: SetRequest is sent from a client to the target to update values in the data tree. Paths are either deleted by the client, or modified by means of being updated, or replaced. Where a replace is used, unspecified values are considered to be replaced, whereas when update is used the changes are considered to be incremental. The set of changes that are specified within a single SetRequest are considered to be a transaction. Reference: gNMI Specification Section 3.4.1

The gnmi.Error message can be used to add additional details where required. Reference: gNMI Specification Section 3.4.2

member.name: T:Gnmi.GetRequest
member.summary: GetRequest is sent when a client initiates a Get RPC. It is used to specify the set of data elements for which the target should return a snapshot of data. The use_models field specifies the set of schema modules that are to be used by the target - where use_models is not specified then the target must use all schema models that it has. member.name: M:Gnmi.gNMI.gNMIClient.Capabilities(Gnmi.CapabilityRequest,Grpc.Core.Metadata,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Capabilities allows the client to retrieve the set of capabilities that is supported by the target. This allows the target to validate the service version that is implemented and retrieve the set of models that the target supports. The models can then be specified in subsequent RPCs to restrict the set of data that is utilized. Reference: gNMI Specification Section 3.2
member.param: The request to send to the server.
The initial metadata to send with the call. This parameter is optional.
An optional deadline for the call. The call will be cancelled if deadline is hit.
An optional token for canceling the call.
member.returns: The response received from the server.

member.name: M:Gnmi.gNMI.gNMIClient.Subscribe(Grpc.Core.Metadata,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Subscribe allows a client to request the target to send it values of particular paths within the data tree. These values may be streamed at a particular cadence (STREAM), sent one off on a long-lived channel (POLL), or sent as a one-off retrieval (ONCE). Reference: gNMI Specification Section 3.5
member.param: The initial metadata to send with the call. This parameter is optional.
An optional deadline for the call. The call will be cancelled if deadline is hit.
An optional token for canceling the call.
member.returns: The call object.

member.name: T:GnmiExt.MasterArbitration
member.summary: MasterArbitration is used to select the master among multiple gNMI clients with the same Roles. The client with the largest election_id is honored as the master. The document about gNMI master arbitration can be found at https://github.com/openconfig/reference/blob/master/rpc/gnmi/gnmi-master-arbitration.md
